creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: long line of expressive calligraphy, shorter signature line at L; light grey-green mount
inscription: 北冥有魚其名為鯤(In the arctic regions there is a fish and its name is K\'un. (SA))
markings: URC, rectangular intaglio:知玄知黙; LLQ, square intaglio seals:　土井恪印；　士恭氏；
title: Single Line from Zhuangzi
